name: simpletime
info:
This lightweight sub-flow produces a Date/Time output in different formats for use in node-red flows.  
The sub-flow creates a `simpletime` node which can be inserted in any running flow, and adds the following messages to the flow; 

* msg.myrawdate: "2017-11-08T20:36:26.257Z"
* msg.myepoch: 1510173386257
* msg.mydate: "Wed Nov 08 2017"
* msg.myhour: "20"
* msg.myminute: "36"
* msg.myminutes: "36:26"
* msg.mysecond: "26"
* msg.mytime: "20:36"
* msg.mytimes: "20:36:26"

All other messages such as msg.payload & topic pass straight through the node unhindered.

To introduce any of the messages into a flow, simply assign any, or any combination of the messages into a variable(s), such as; `var seconds = msg.myseconds;`  
or to use in a ui_text node add via mustache `{{msg.mytimes}}` 

For advanced functionality, I would strongly recommend using the node-red-contrib-moment which is better equipped to handle edge-cases.

Any feedback - please give me a shout - @rossoreed on [node-red slack](https://nodered.org/slack)

name: Var Last Motion
info:
Reads motion sensor inputs from:
- Office
- Doorbell
- Garage
- Kitchen
- Living Room
- Workbench

and reports the friendly name as the var.last_alarm value.

name: Tell me if a garage door has been open longer than the timer value.
info:
Somebody else wrote this as a reminder to close their garage door.
I really *should* not require this, but it didn't hurt me to leave it as a double-check.

name: Build message
func:
msg.payload += " has been open for 5 minutes";
return msg;

name: Car or No Car
Armed or not?
Build an email
Close both doors
info:
1. Toggle input boolean that I have set up as an entity button in Lovelace.
2. Checks state of both doors.
3. If closed, report 'door not open'
4. If not closed, close door
5. There is a 3 second delay to allow the announcements to not step on each other.
